page.title: 07FRESHWATER INSHORE RESCUE
page.content: The boat's name is John and Vivien Nicholson. It has twin 80 horse power engine. Mr S. Norris is 1st coxswain, Mr M. Gould is 2nd coxswain. The boat goes at 50 m.p.h. It takes 9 minutes to launch the boat after the fire siren calls out the men. They have a small D class boat and it's made of rubber. It takes 3 crew for cliff rescues. The boat was built in Cowes and designed to self right itself. All men have a Bronze Medallion medal, they have to swim a mile in 40 minutes. They have Â£5000 money raised locally and they have Â£5000 grant from the Solent Safety Organisation. They have to have dry suits that cost Â£158 each. Their area is from the Needles to St. Catherines.
